snippet: A funding solution to the state’s worst budget shortfall in decades evoked bipartisan criticism, but was viewed as a necessity to get a budget past Gov. Bobby Jindal.
abstract: Louisiana legislators agree at 11th hour on complex funding arrangement to avert $1.6 billion budget shortfall; deal is maligned by lawmakers on both sides of aisle, but is seen as only possible way to earn approval of Gov Bobby Jindal; deal will allow Jindal to claim that he has technically not raised net new tax revenue, though it does include millions in cigarette tax hikes and tax break rollbacks.

byline.original: By CAMPBELL ROBERTSON and JEREMY ALFORD

lead_paragraph: A funding solution to the state’s worst budget shortfall in decades evoked bipartisan criticism, but was viewed as a necessity to get a budget past Gov. Bobby Jindal.

headline.main: Louisiana Lawmakers Hold Their Noses as They Balance the Budget
headline.print_headline: Louisiana Lawmakers Hold Their Noses as They Balance the Budget
